    • Constructor Detail

      • GameEngine

        public GameEngine()
        Constructor. Instantiating of: userInterface, map, characters and the starting value of the output string.

    • Method Detail

      • updateUserInput

        public void updateUserInput()
        Convert the current keycode to a string and determines what function to call based on the games state.

      • initializeGame

        public void initializeGame()
        Represent the user for the first menu and reacts on the defined inputs.

      • startGame

        private void startGame()
        Starts up the necessary precautions before starting the games loop. Minimum one hero and one monster is created. The games loop will be started when characters and a map is loaded.

      • gameLoop

        private void gameLoop()
        This is the games loop from where the actual basic logic of the game takes place. Step 1: A user is prompted for an input for where to go. Step 2: If no fight has occurred, then move the monsters. Step 3: If a fight has occurred, then enter a combat scene. Step 4: If a monster won the combat, the send the hero back to his previous location. Step 5: If the monster lost, then delete him from the game, reward the hero with experience and update the database. Step 6: If there are no more monster left in the map, then spawn as many monsters as the hero's level. (Max 5) Step 7: Start over by prompting for an input for where to go. The output string is updated for each run through.

      • getCharactersFighting

        private Character[] getCharactersFighting()
        Return a Character array containing the two fighting characters. If nothing is found, null is returned. The first character in the returned Character array represents the hero character.

      • getStats

        public java.lang.String getStats()
        Return a string representing the stats for each character in the game.

      • processUserInput

        private void processUserInput(java.lang.String input)
        Do the appropriate hero movement according to the users input.
        Parameters:
        input - - This should be the the users input.

      • moveMonsters

        private void moveMonsters()
        Move all monsters within the characters list. X and Y movements are randomly chosen from -1 to 1.

      • exitGame

        private void exitGame()
        Print a little kind message

      • moveCharacter

        private void moveCharacter(Character character,
                           java.awt.Point point)
        Move the given character with the amount of values from the provided point. This is only done if a success is returned.
        Parameters:
        character - - This is the character that should be moved.
        point - - This is for how much the characters location should be moved.

      • createCharacter

        private void createCharacter(boolean userDefined)
        Create either a user defined character (hero) or create one or more monsters depending on the map. If the specified hero name already exist in the database, then load settings for that hero name. If the used have asked for a reset of the hero, then settings will be reset and updated in the database.
        Parameters:
        userDefined - - True if the user should define a hero. False if monsters should be created.

      • spawnExtraMonsters

        private void spawnExtraMonsters(int amount,
                                int level)
        Spawn the specified amount of monsters of the provided level. A maximum of five monsters will be spawned.
        Parameters:
        amount - - This is the amount of monsters to create.
        level - - This is of what level the monsters should be.

      • listMaps

        private void listMaps(boolean showOnly)
        Represent the user for either a menu displaying the maps or a menu for selecting a map.
        Parameters:
        showOnly - - True if a displaying menu should be shown. False if a selection menu should be shown.

      • convertToInteger

        private int convertToInteger(java.lang.String string)
        Convert a string to an integer if possible, if not possible then a value of -1 is returned instead.
        Parameters:
        string - - This is the string to be converted.
